intro: Turraea grandidieri, commonly known as the Madagascar turraea, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by specialized bracts. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is typically found in forested areas. Due to habitat loss, Turraea grandidieri is considered endangered and is of particular interest in botanical conservation efforts.
